title: (x) Wine Label Sans type ID, "Pinot Noir / Les Hospitalieres" text - Duepuntozero {Ryuk}
author: gilesdickerson

comments.content: It looks like a rounded avante garde, is there one?

It's what I would class as a Bauhaus-style font, of the [Oblong kind](http://web.archive.org/web/20100313191003/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/BauhausFaces4.html). Tantalus, with its alternate (from T-26), is sort of similar, but there are differences. Your sample's 'a' could have been made from the Tantalus 'o'(almost), but still the s and r are not the same in either face. I suppose it might be a customization of Tantalus, but more likely it's a new font I haven't met yet.

- Mike Yanega
Here it is, nice call bowfinpw! [http://www.abstractfonts.com/font/13652](http://web.archive.org/web/20100313191003/http:/www.abstractfonts.com/font/13652 "http://www.abstractfonts.com/font/13652")

Dafont has the newer versions of regular and bold, plus black.  
 [http://www.dafont.com/duepuntozero.font?nb\_ppp=50&af=on](http://web.archive.org/web/20100313191003/http:/www.dafont.com/duepuntozero.font?nb_ppp=50&af=on "http://www.dafont.com/duepuntozero.font?nb\_ppp=50&af=on")

Fontsy has the initial release of regular and bold only.
